Summary: Crimson red orbs observed in the night sky over southern Louisiana moving from west to east.
divs: sighting detailsit was about 11:35 at night and i was driving home from work when i first noticed a large pattern of lights visible directly in front of me about 50 degrees from the horizon. i initially thought they might be flares but they were moving to fast laterally to be flares. they were crimson red in color and appeared to flutter or twinkle a bit. there were 5 orbs total moving from west to east just below the cloud line. they were moving slightly faster than a plane would be. each light\orb was flying at a different altitude from one another and appeared to be in some sort of large formation. i pulled over into a gas station to observe them further, but as i was doing this the lights started to fade out and then disappeared. the total time i was able to observe was about 2 minutes. i often gaze into the night sky and have observed many planes, helicopters, satellites, etc.. but these orbs definitely seemed to be something different.
trends: There have been 8 other sightings in Houma
There were no other sightings in Houma on or around July 26th 2013
